description._content: William H. Palmer was born in New Salem, Ohio and received both his B.S. and M.S. from the College of Agriculture at The Ohio State University. He was a specialist in animal husbandry at Ohio State as well as a state leader in the boys' and girls' agriculture clubs. His wife, the former Miss Leila Work of Lancaster, Ohio attended Miami University. They had two sons, Carl and Dean William. Dean Palmer was president of his high school class of 1936. Both Carl and Dean Palmer attended Ohio State and were active in the construction of the university's first golf course. The course construction was initially funded by the University Athletic Board, but, in 1935, it became a WPA project. The course was completed in 1940. The Palmer family resided at 1789 Bedford Road. This image available online at the UA Archives >> Read the related "Norwester" magazine article at the UA Archives >> ---------------------------------------- Identifier: hinw11p018i01 Date (yyyy-mm-dd): c. 1918-09 Original Dimensions: 3.2 cm x 6.5 cm Format: Black and White Halftone Photograph Source: Norwester, September 1918, page 18 Original Publisher: Upper Arlington Community (Ohio) Location/s: Upper Arlington (USA, Ohio, Franklin County) Repository: Upper Arlington Historical Society Digital Publisher: Upper Arlington Public Library, UA Archives Credit: UA Archives - Upper Arlington Public Library (Repository: UA Historical Society)
